feed.title: Concerns Regarding Threats by a Developer to Remove Commit Access from Other Developers

entry.title: Concerns Regarding Threats by a Developer to Remove Commit Access from Other Developers
entry.summary: In a recent post, the author clarifies that they are not the decider for anything related to the behavior of the global consensus. They highlight the significance of the person who decides if a pull request is accepted as they significantly affect the behavior of the global consensus. In case someone does not agree with their decision, the only option left is to hard fork. The author advises accepting this fact and moving forward.
